metadata.description: Financial reports test dataset for RAG over 10-K / 10-Q / Annual Reports / Proxy Statements
metadata.purpose: Evaluate RAG system on real-world financial documents of public companies

queries.question: What are the main business segments of the company according to the latest annual report?
In which geographic regions does the company generate most of its revenue?
Summarize the company’s core products and services described in the annual report.
How does the company describe its overall business model and value proposition?
What was the company’s total revenue in the most recent fiscal year, and how did it change compared to the previous year?
What are the main drivers of revenue growth mentioned in the Management’s Discussion and Analysis (MD&A)?
How does the company break down its revenue by segment or product line?
What are the company’s operating income and net income for the latest year, and what are the main reasons for any significant changes?
How much did the company spend on research and development (R&D) in the latest fiscal year?
Describe the company’s capital structure: what is the mix between debt and equity according to the balance sheet?
What are the top three risk factors highlighted in the Risk Factors section of the annual report?
Does the company mention dependence on key suppliers or customers as a risk, and how is this described?
How does the company describe competitive risks in its industry?
Are there any legal or regulatory proceedings disclosed that could materially affect the company’s financial position?
Who are the key executive officers of the company according to the latest proxy statement or annual report?
How is the board of directors structured (size, independence, key committees)?
What performance metrics are used to determine executive compensation?
Does the company mention any recent changes in leadership or the board, and what are the reasons?
What are the company’s main strategic priorities for the next few years as described by management?
How does the company plan to allocate capital (e.g., investments, dividends, share buybacks, debt repayment)?
Which acquisitions, divestitures, or major investments were completed during the reporting period?
How does management describe the company’s competitive advantages or moats?
What environmental, social, and governance (ESG) topics does the company highlight as most material?
Does the company disclose greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions or climate-related targets?
How does the company describe its approach to diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI)?
Are there any notable ESG-related risks or controversies mentioned in the report?
How has the company’s revenue growth over the last three years compared to its net income growth?
Compare the share of revenue coming from the top business segment now versus two years ago.
How has the company’s debt level changed over the last three reporting periods?
What changes in risk factors are highlighted when comparing the latest report to the previous year?
Locate and summarize the table that presents the breakdown of revenue by geographic region.
Identify the note in the financial statements that explains the company’s revenue recognition policy and summarize it.
Which accounting standards (e.g., IFRS, US GAAP) does the company use, and are there any significant recent changes mentioned?
Find and summarize any sensitivity analysis related to interest rates, foreign exchange, or other market risks.
Does the report include non-GAAP financial measures, and how does the company reconcile them to GAAP/IFRS figures?
What key macroeconomic or industry trends does management highlight as influencing the company’s performance?
What is the company’s free cash flow in the latest year, if disclosed, and how is it calculated?
Are there any shareholder proposals or significant voting results discussed in the proxy statement?
Does the company link executive compensation to ESG or sustainability metrics?
How does the company plan to address key risks and uncertainties mentioned in the report?
